intro: Alepidocline macrocephala, commonly known as the large-headed alepidocline, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its large, showy inflorescences that consist of numerous small flowers arranged in a circular pattern. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged alternately along the stem. Alepidocline macrocephala is often found in rocky or open habitats at higher elevations.
